step1.title: Upload a Dance Video
step1.description: Choose any dance video you want to learn from. Drag and drop or click to browse. We support MP4, WebM, and MOV formats.
tips: Choose videos with clear, full-body movements
Shorter clips (30-60 seconds) work best for practice
Ensure the dancer is clearly visible throughout

step2.title: Set Up Your Camera
step2.description: Select your webcam and adjust settings. Enable mirror mode if it helps you follow along more naturally.
tips: Position your camera to capture your full body
Ensure good lighting for better pose detection
Keep your background clear if possible

step3.title: Calibration Check
step3.description: Before starting, we'll check that you're properly positioned. Make sure your full body is visible and you have enough space.
tips: Stand about 2-3 meters from your camera
Make sure you have room to move
Wear clothes that contrast with your background

step4.title: Start Dancing!
step4.description: Follow along with the teacher video. Get real-time encouragement and friendly tips to help you feel the rhythm.
tips: Focus on having fun and feeling the music
Follow the encouraging messages as you dance
Every move counts - just keep dancing!

encouragementGuide.title: How Feedback Works
encouragementGuide.description: DanceTwin gives you friendly, encouraging feedback as you dance. No grades or scores - just supportive messages to keep you moving!

levels.niceMovesDesc: Looking good, keep that energy going
levels.keepItUpDesc: You're getting the hang of it
levels.dancingDesc: Just keep moving and have fun

items.solution: Check browser permissions and ensure no other app is using your camera
Improve lighting and ensure your full body is visible
Make sure you're visible on camera and moving with the music
